2_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr.body: Strong cryptography is widely available as open source and can't be stopped by governments.

The problem with backdoors is that it can't be implemented in open source encryption software. There will always be too many versions without backdoors available around the world and governments can't win that fight.

Also, it would impossible to get every government on the planet to agree on backdoors.
